question: What's the difference between standards and quirks mode?

answers.answer: When W3C standards came out browsers couldn't start using them right away so there was two modes standards and quirks mode
Quirks mode refers to WebKit browsers and standards mode refers to IE
Quirks mode is used for testing and standards mode is used in production websites
Quirks mode refers to the developer tools and standards mode refers to the browser window

question: Difference between document load event and document ready event?
